place.name: SOUTH HILL
place.gazetteerText: SOUTHILL or South-Hill, a parish in Liskeard district, Cornwall; 3 miles NW of Callington, and 8¼ NE of Liskeard r. station. Post town, Callington, Cornwall. Acres, 3,459. Real property, £3,951. Pop., 691. Houses, 127. The manor belongs to Lady Ashburton. The living is a rectory, united with Callington, in the diocese of Exeter. Value, £748.* Patron, Lady Ashburton. The church is ancient. There are a Wesleyan chapel, a national school, and charities £13. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
